perturbation.original_text: 1.8 "Dassault Systemes Customer(s)" means any customer of the Co-Branded Service having accessed such Web service, wherever hosted, by first logging in on any Dassault Systemes Web site.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.8 "Dassault Systemes Customer(s)" means only customers who have purchased a premium subscription to the Co-Branded Service and have accessed it through a Dassault Systemes Web site.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the definition of 'Dassault Systemes Customer(s)'. The original definition includes any customer accessing the service through a Dassault Systemes website. The modified definition restricts it to only those with a premium subscription, potentially impacting revenue sharing calculations and access rights.

perturbation.original_text:
5.4 Share of Net Revenue. As financial consideration under this Agreement, Net Revenue will be shared by the parties as follows:

                 (a)   For so long as PlanetCAD hosts the Co-Branded Service,
                         during which time PlanetCAD shall be the Billing Party,
                         all Net Revenue derived from sales of the Co-Branded
                         Service to Dassault Systemes Customers shall be
                         apportioned [***] percent ([***]%) to Dassault Systems
                         and [***] percent ([***]%) to PlanetCAD.

                 (b)   In the event that Dassault Systemes opts to host the
                         Co-Branded Service pursuant to Section 4.7  [Change of Hosting] herein they
                         shall become the Billing Party and all Net Revenue
                         derived from sales of the Co-Branded Service shall be
                         apportioned [***] percent ([***]%) to Dassault Systems
                         and [***] percent ([***]%) to PlanetCAD.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.4 Share of Net Revenue. As financial consideration under this Agreement, Net Revenue will be shared by the parties as follows:

                 (a)   For so long as PlanetCAD hosts the Co-Branded Service,
                         during which time PlanetCAD shall be the Billing Party,
                         all Net Revenue derived from sales of the Co-Branded
                         Service to Dassault Systemes Customers shall be
                         apportioned [***] percent ([***]%) to Dassault Systems
                         and [***] percent ([***]%) to PlanetCAD. This apportionment only applies if the customer was acquired through Dassault Systemes marketing efforts.

                 (b)   In the event that Dassault Systemes opts to host the
                         Co-Branded Service pursuant to Section 4.7  [Change of Hosting] herein they
                         shall become the Billing Party and all Net Revenue
                         derived from sales of the Co-Branded Service shall be
                         apportioned [***] percent ([***]%) to Dassault Systems
                         and [***] percent ([***]%) to PlanetCAD. This apportionment only applies to the base subscription fee; any additional services or upgrades will be split 50/50.
perturbation.explanation: This change adds conditions to the revenue sharing percentages. In (a), it limits the apportionment to customers acquired through Dassault Systemes' marketing, potentially excluding customers who found the service independently. In (b), it changes the apportionment for additional services, creating conflict and uncertainty over the exact share of revenue from different sources. It makes the revenue sharing calculation very confusing.

perturbation.original_text: 10.2 Breach. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time in the event that the other party is in default or breach of any material provision of this Agreement, and such default or breach continues unremedied for a period of sixty days after written notice thereof. In addition to the right to terminate this Agreement, the non-breaching party, shall have all rights and remedies available at law and in equity.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.2 Breach. Either party may terminate this Agreement only in the event that the other party is in default or breach of Section 3 of this Agreement and such default or breach continues unremedied for a period of sixty days after written notice thereof. In such a case, the breaching party will only be liable for actual and direct damages; consequential damages are explicitly waived.
perturbation.explanation: This change significantly restricts the conditions under which the agreement can be terminated. The original clause allows termination for any material breach, whereas the modified clause limits it to breaches of Section 3. The added limitation of liability also contradicts the original clause by disallowing consequential damages, altering the remedies available to the non-breaching party. This introduces significant legal ambiguities regarding breach remedies and termination rights.
